TL;DR at bottom. Also, I played the game using the optional uncensor-patch provided by the devs. Check the pinned discussions in the games forums, I recommend using it, the added content is tasteful and serves to further develop characters, as well as provide greater emotional connection to the characters.  Okay, so now that I have finished the game, I've decided to completely redo my review. First things first: Before you play this, at least play through most of the original game, Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius. It is free, it is wonderful, and this game contains a lot of references to that one. Seriously, it's phenomenal, free or not, and it's not even finished, another episode will be added later this year.   This games biggest weakness is pacing, both story-wise and gameplay-wise. The story pacing issues are made worse by the gameplay pacing issues, as sometimes reaching a certain even or fulfilling the requirements to trigger an event can either take a very long time, or if you didn't manage things well or hadn't yet figured out the game in the case of triggering an event, attempts to do so can make things more difficult for you.   The beginning of the game is very fast and doesn't explain itself well, and the end becomes a mindless cycle after the first go because nothing really matters at that point. For a game that requires multiple playthroughs to experience all the stories, the gameplay lacks variety, as the majority of the requirements are identical for each route. That said, once it's figured out, you can speed through the downtime fairly quickly, and if you find the stat managing gameplay unenjoyable or too difficult, there is a mode that makes it impossible to fail, so you can just experience the story, which is well worth the price alone, in my opinion.   As for the story, pacing is inconsistent. Each of the routes is paced differently, which is both good and bad. Good in that it keeps things varied, bad in that a couple of sections in a couple of the 4 routes available feel... slow. I found myself growing impatient, made worse by the fact that I was reaching the point in the game where the gameplay becomes a mindless routine where nothing is really significant. The slow sections have a purpose, and in the context of the story alone are understandable and meaningful, if not the most engaging, but they are made somewhat frustrating by the monotony of the gameplay during that portion of the route.   That pretty much covers the slightly more objective issues with the game. I personally don't really have many other criticisms, and no major ones to speak of. The music of the game is nice, but the tracks are rather short, and they loop during any given section, which can be annoying during particularly long story sequences. It didn't bother me much, but I did notice. Other little things include minor typos and slightly awkward phrasing, which were noticeable but didn't take away from the writing in any real sense.   So, on to the things that I like about the game. The writing is really strong. The stories that are told have great variety, strong plot twists, and generally have a lot of impact. The characters all have unique personalities and grow throughout the game, changing in various ways, doing unexpected things and genuinely surprising the player. This is true for all the routes, I found the stories told to be engaging, emotional, fun and heartwarming, and they all have their fair share of laughs. The support characters are all very interesting as well.   On to the art style. Its anime, okay? If you don't like anime, why are you here? That said, I don't feel that the art is generic or cliche. The character designs are all reasonably grounded, there are no crazy hair or overly stylized outfits, and each of the characters are easily distinguishable by more than just hair. The backgrounds are satisfactory. A couple of them are quite exceptional, the rest are just okay, but none of them are bad. The CG's are all nice as well, and while I do have my personal favorites, that is going to be a very personal preference, and all were of good quality.   TL:DR: This game has its issues. The first playthrough is tense and fun, well paced with common events, the following 3 to finish the remaining routes suffer from a lack of challenge and slower pacing due to already having experienced the common events. Outside of that, I absolutely adored this game, and didn't feel that these issues lessened my enjoyment too greatly. The characters are great, the writing does nearly everything right, there is a lot of variety story-wise, and the art is all high-quality and thoroughly enjoyable. I wholeheartedly recommend this one, but if you have yet to play the original game, Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius, play it first. It is great, it's free, and it makes this game a better experience.

This game came bundled with Shadow Warrior and I played it through and got 100 % achievements in two hours of playtime. So, what can you write about a game after 2 hours of perfect completition?  Probably you already know the point of this game: you need to clean up the place with a mop and water. You incinerate the objects you find on the floor and you collect money to get the two million dollar achievement and make sure you don't incinerate the money in the process.  So, the idea is nice, but I'll be honest: collecting and washing up for two hours is perfectly enough. It was fun for free, but I'd not really wished to pay for this (the same stands for the another Viscera spinoff: Santa's Rampage... maybe I'll get that once, but not sure).  The physics sometimes a little weird, but it's acceptable. The only thing which really bothered me was when I put objects into the biohazard bucket then tried to bring the bucket to the incinerator, the objects inside were jumping annoyingly. This usually made me just bring the objects one by one to the incinerator instead of putting them into the bucket.  So yeah: wouldn't really buy it for over a dollar but it's fine in a bundle. I had some fun for free and we owe a huge 'thank you' for the developers to provide this game for us. If you have one or two free hours and you want to have two extra achievements, play this, it's a nice little game. Otherwise just stick with Shadow Warrior and do the cleaning in real life between levels. :)

its good.

This is the Total War I have been waiting for. While I love the historic settings of the main line Total War series (Empire is my favorite), seeing what they can do when the developers are allowed to stray outside the lines of history and into fantasy has warped my fragile little mind. I want more, I hope they do more fantasy themed entries. Maybe they could use some books for inspiration (Wheel of Time, Game of Thrones, LotR, ect..). I most enthusatically recommend this game to anyone who enjoys a good RTS and especially to player of the Warhammer table top game.

I Love Board Games! I really love Small World in classic table top form. And here we are, with PC version of this iconic ;) title. Is it good? Yeah!! Basically it is a the same game but only in electronic format. We have the same art, the same rules. What is extra? Multiplayer over internet, so there is no need to look for other players with a free time to play table top version.  I recommend this to all board game lovers.
